meanings.definition: An amount obtained by adding numbers together.
meanings.sent1: I calculated the subtotals of all the items in my shopping cart.
meanings.sent2: The cashier added up the subtotals of each item to get the final bill.
meanings.sent3: The subtotals of the ingredients in the recipe were more than I expected.
meanings.sent4: Her savings account was like a collection of subtotals waiting to be spent.
meanings.sent5: The subtotals on the receipt made it clear how much each item cost.

meanings.definition: To calculate the total of a group of numbers.
meanings.sent1: She subtotals the expenses at the end of each month to track her spending.
meanings.sent2: The accountant subtotals the columns to ensure accuracy in the financial report.
meanings.sent3: I subtotals the scores of the game to see who won.
meanings.sent4: The teacher subtotals the points to determine the winner of the competition.
meanings.sent5: He subtotals the prices of the items to see if he can afford them all.
